texts.definition: The goal of removing game elements from gameplay.
markups: <style="Definition">The goal of removing game elements from gameplay.</style>
One of the most common goals in games is to remove game elements from play. Players that have these goals have <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Chess">Chess</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Stratego">Stratego</link></style> are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style> which are won by succeeding with <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals, or in the case of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Chess">Chess</link></style> making it unavoidable. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Backgammon">Backgammon</link></style> in contrast is a weak example since even if a single opponent's piece is removed from play when taken, the piece can be brought back to the game later. The single-player puzzle game <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Peg%20Solitaire">Peg Solitaire</link></style> consists of eliminating all game elements from the game board save one.

The <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Counter-Strike%20series">Counter-Strike series</link></style> differs from many other first-person shooters in that players who are killed are eliminated for the remainder of the match.

Common reasons to introduce <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals in games include making <style="Link"><link="agents">Agents</link></style> into <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> and causing <style="Link"><link="gain-ownership">Gain Ownership</link></style> struggles over <style="Link"><link="territories">Territories</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals can also be given to players to provide them with <style="Link"><link="quests">Quests</link></style>. Giving <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals directed towards each member in a <style="Link"><link="teams">Team</link></style> creates <style="Link"><link="team-elimination">Team Elimination</link></style> goals and this can be further encouraged through <style="Link"><link="collections">Collection</link></style> goals.

<style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals requires a target or targets to destroy as well as means to do so. While simply <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="boss-monsters">Boss Monsters</link></style>, or players' <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style> might be designated as the targets, the use of <style="Link"><link="choke-points">Choke Points</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="inaccessible-areas">Inaccessible Areas</link></style> together with <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> can make fulfilling the goal a necessity rather than a voluntary choice (for <style="Link"><link="choke-points">Choke Points</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="obstacles">Obstacles</link></style> can work instead of <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> since their mere presence can hinder players). By their definition <style="Link"><link="destructible-objects">Destructible Objects</link></style> invite players to <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> them since it is possible to do so. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Resource%20Generators">Resource Generators</link></style> can also become targets to <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> if the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> they create are unwanted, especially if they are <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>; if a goal in the game is to <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> then the presence of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Resource%20Generators">Resource Generators</link></style> makes that goal have <style="Link"><link="dynamic-goal-characteristics">Dynamic Goal Characteristics</link></style> (regarding the number <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> that need to be eliminated). Struggle over <style="Link"><link="tools">Tools</link></style> in <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> can make other players into targets as well. That <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> provide <style="Link"><link="loot">Loot</link></style> or carry <style="Link"><link="macguffins">MacGuffins</link></style> can make players more intent towards fulfilling <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals as well as being the reason why the <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> are seen as <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style>. Given <style="Link"><link="units">Units</link></style> goals to <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> game elements important to players of course also makes them into <style="Link"><link="enemies">Enemies</link></style> and targets of <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals.

<style="Link"><link="aim-shoot">Aim & Shoot</link></style> is a common solution to provide players with actions to succeed with <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals. <style="Link"><link="traps">Traps</link></style> are less common but can encourage <style="Link"><link="stimulated-planning">Stimulated Planning</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Connection">Connection</link></style> is another option, as is <style="Link"><link="consumers">Consumers</link></style> but none of these in themselves enable the possibility of performing the necessary actions. <style="Link"><link="bidding">Bidding</link></style> allows for a type of <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals that consist of making all others involved give up rather than eliminating them.

Many patterns can affect how <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals can be solved. First, <style="Link"><link="evade">Evade</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> goals of the targets make the goals more difficult. Such <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> goals are instantiated from <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals when the targets of <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals are players or <style="Link"><link="agents">Agents</link></style> (and are then also <style="Link"><link="preventing-goals">Preventing Goals</link></style>); otherwise <style="Link"><link="survive">Survive</link></style> goals are a way to modulate <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals.

<style="Link"><link="invulnerabilities">Invulnerabilities</link></style> can make the goal impossible to solve but <style="Link"><link="achilles-heels">Achilles' Heels</link></style> can make this an erroneous perception of players rather than a true fact. The use of <style="Link"><link="damage">Damage</link></style> system can make <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals require several different successful actions to succeed against opponents, and <style="Link"><link="factions">Factions</link></style> can make <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals require the elimination of several opponents for the goal to be completed. <style="Link"><link="safe-havens">Safe Havens</link></style> makes it only possible to kill the target of <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals in certain places.

<style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals give rise to <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Conflicts">Conflicts</link></style> and typically <style="Link"><link="combat">Combat</link></style> and goals related to <style="Link"><link="overcome">Overcome</link></style> opponents. It leads to attempts of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Game%20Element%20Removal">Game Element Removal</link></style> and/or <style="Link"><link="capture">Capture</link></style>, and potentially <style="Link"><link="player-elimination">Player Elimination</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="early-elimination">Early Elimination</link></style>. Being the target of <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals also affects how players control their <style="Link"><link="avatars">Avatars</link></style>.

Player targets of <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals run the risk of getting <style="Link"><link="penalties">Penalties</link></style> if the goal are completed, and for this reason <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> tends to generate <style="Link"><link="preventing-goals">Preventing Goals</link></style> for those targets.

If <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> goals are at focus for discernible period of gameplay time, they can define <style="Link"><link="extermination">Extermination</link></style> phases while if players are given <style="Link"><link="symmetric-goals">Symmetric Goals</link></style> to <style="CurrentLink">Eliminate</style> each other <style="Link"><link="last-man-standing">Last Man Standing</link></style> situations occur.
